p: Influenza-related pneumonia (Flu-p) is the major kind of severe influenza, which contributes to 20â€“50% of influenza-related hospitalizations [ 12]. Here, we conducted a multicenter, retrospective study aimed to evaluate the impact of virus type A and type B on the illness severity and clinical outcomes of immunocompetent, adolescents and adults hospitalized with Flu-p onset in community.
